title: Entry-Level HR Assistant Job at Avatar New Energy Materials Company Limited
keyword: avatar new energy materials company limited
content:
Avatar New Energy Materials Co. Limited is a pioneering Chinese Company in Nigeria's mining sector, specializing in the exploration, mining, and processing of lithium. We arej committed to sustainable practices, innovative technologies, and community development. Our mission is to become a leading supplier of high-quality lithium products, driving the global transition to renewable energy. The company's business scope includes mining investment, project operations, mining, spodumene acquisition/processing/sales, geological exploration drilling, Technical consultation, metal (non-metal) laboratory analysis, etc.we are located in Nasarawa State.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Entry-Level HR Assistant

Job Location: Kama-Otto, Nasarawa (10km away from Federal Polytechnic Nasarawa, Loko Road)
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Assist with recruitment processes, including posting job ads and scheduling interviews
	Maintain employee records and update HR databases
	Support onboarding and offboarding processes
	Help coordinate training sessions and HR events
	Provide general administrative support to the HR department.


Requirements


	A Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field is preferred.
	1 - 2 years of experience in an HR or administrative role
	Strong organizational and communication skills
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary (N120,000 - N150,000 monthly)
	Opportunities for professional development
	A collaborative and supportive work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter to: hr@avtne.com using “HR Assistant" as the subject of the email.

title: Accounts Receivable Officer Job at Sahara Group
content:
Sahara Group is a leading international energy and infrastructure conglomerate with operations in over 38 countries across Africa, Middle East, Europe and Asia. Spanning three decades, we have broken ground and challenged stereotypes across the global business landscape. The women and men who make up our organization are our strongest levers for growth.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accounts Receivable Officer

Job Identification: 373
Job Location: Ijora, Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Role Accountabilities

	Support the corporate strategy of the business with the view to ensuring its consistent profitability and continued daily posting of sales into the financial system

title: Sales Executive - Machine Job at Mantrac
content:
Mantrac is the sole distributor for Caterpillar products in Nigeria, distributing and supporting machinery, power systems and material-handling equipment. The company provides customers with comprehensive solutions, backed by technical know-how, experience and in-depth knowledge of their local markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Executive - Machine

Job Location: Lagos

Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Responsible for achieving or exceeding agreed sales targets for the Company’s range of EPG (Electric Power Generation) products within the assigned geographical territory and market sector.


Main Function


	Obtain order that meet or exceed agreed targets and negotiate equipment sales into high valued projects.
	Ensure that full payments are received for all units sold while all necessary sales documents are adequately prepared.
	Provide product related technical assistance and advise to customers and prospects
	Obtain and communicate information relating to the market and competition as appropriate.
	Arrange visits to existing and prospective customers to ensure maximum coverage of the territory.
	Aggressively promote the company’s product within the catchment area and win more prospects there from.
	Maintain good corporate reputation and effective communication between our clients/customers and MNL Management.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a B.Sc./ HND in Engineering or equivalent. 
	At least 2 years of experience in the industry (sales, marketing & technical experience). 
	Good written and spoken English. 
	Interpersonal and communication skills with leadership skills and ability to take the initiative. 
	Good analytical and computer skills. 
	Having good selling skills is an advantage.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: recruitment@mantracnigeria.com using the Job Position as subject of email.

title: Accountant Job at Skipper Eye-Q Super Specialty Eye Hospital
keyword: skipper eye-q super specialty eye hospital
content:
Skipper Eye-Q Super Speciality Eye hospital is an International Eye Hospital chain with the presence of 30 in India and 4 in Nigeria handling all types of Eye Surgeries such as Cataract, Retina, Glaucoma, Presbyopia, Cornea, Squint, Refractive error and other vision problems, having treated 10+ Million patients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Manage all accounting transactions.
	Prepare budget forecasts.
	Publish financial statements in time.
	Handle monthly, quarterly and annual closings.
	Manage balance sheets and profit/loss statements.
	Report on the company’s financial health and liquidity.
	Audit financial transactions and documents.
	Reconcile accounts payable and receivable.
	Ensure timely bank payments.
	Compute taxes and prepare tax returns.
	Reinforce financial data confidentiality and conduct database backups when necessary.
	Compiling, analyzing, and reporting financial data.
	Presenting data to managers, investors, and other entities.
	Comply with financial policies and regulations.
	Complying with all company, local, state, and federal accounting and financial regulations.
	Keeping informed about current legislation relating to finance and accounting.
	Assisting management in the decision-making process by preparing budgets and financial forecasts.


Requirements and skills


	B.Sc in Accounting, Finance or relevant Degree.
	Minimum of 6 - 7 years of work experience as an Accountant is required.
	Excellent knowledge of accounting regulations and procedures, including the Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP).
	Hands-on experience with accounting softwares such as SAP and others.
	Advanced MS Excel skills including Vlookups and pivot tables.
	Experience with general ledger functions.
	Strong attention to detail and good analytical skills.


Method of Application
Interested and Qualified candidates should send CV to skippereyeqhospitals@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail
